lines.text:
[to Flywheel lying on a bed]
Can you tell me the price of this bed?
Why that's preposterous! I can get the same bed anywhere in town for $25.
Yes, but not with me in it!
Tell me, Wolfie dear, will we have a beautiful home?
Of course. You're not planning on moving, are you?
No, but, uh, I'm afraid after we're married awhile, a beautiful young girl will come along, and, uh, you'll forget all about me.
Don't be silly. I'll write you twice a week.
If Ms. Phelps were not my fiancée, I would turn in my resignation and walk out of this store for good!
Oh no, no...
Fiancée?
Yes.
You mean a woman of your culture and money and beauty and money and wealth and money would, would marry that imposter?
I take-a your picture. Hey! Look at me and laugh.
I've been doing that for 20 years.
[Wolf is about to propose to Martha]
Martha, dear, there are many bonds that will hold us together through eternity.
Really, Wolf? What are they?
Your government bonds, your savings bonds, your liberty bonds.

[Flywheel has mistaken the Hastings brothers for the killers and handcuffed them]
There you are. I give you the killers.
Why, it's the Hastings brothers, the men who are going to buy the store.
Gentlemen, I'm terribly sorry, but it's really not my fault. You certainly do look like crooks.
Nagasaki!

[to Wacky]
Hey, pressa' the grapes - no pressa' my wife!
You kids, you practice until I come back. But-a remember! No woogie-boogie.
Hey, I better not leave you. From now on, you and me is gonna be insufferable.
Whew! It's warm in here.
Funny, I don't feel it.
Well, I do.

[Speaking on an "intercom"]
Winthop, have the janitor come up and break a window.
Miss Phelps, I'm turning down all offers to take your case. After all, you're a woman. You are a woman, aren't you?
Tell me, what would you want to handle this case for me?
Twenty thousand dollars.
Don't you think that's too much?
Of course it is, only a cheap chisler would ask that much.
I was prepared to pay five hundred dollars.
Hardly enough. Eh, I'm prepared to take it. Shall we bind the deal with a kiss? Or, five dollars in cash? You lose either way.
What experience have you had at a department store?
I was a shoplifter for three years.
This man's a cad! A yellow cad!
What is this man? A detective? A floorwalker? Or, a poet?
All three. And not bad at making love. Eh, Martha?
[Tickles Martha's chin]
Woo-hoo!
So, you didn't think I was a real detective, eh?
Aw, if you're a detective, I'm a monkey's uncle.
Keep your family out of this!
Why, this place is becoming a madhouse!

[Flywheel lying in a bed in The Big Store, when Guiseppi, his wife, and their 12 children surround the bed. Flywheel sits up]
What other hobbies have you got?
Eh, we like-a to see something different in a bed.
You would? Just press that button over by the davenport.
Where is the davenport?
Its in Iowa.
Hey, what's the difficulty here?
Look, I no get excited like-a my wife; but, I come in here with twelve-a kids and now there only six. What happened my six kids?
What are their draft numbers?
Look-a there only six-a kids and I know I gotta twelve-a kids!
Twelve kids, eh? How much you make a week?
Eh, eh, twenty-five dollars.
You can't afford to have twelve kids!
No tell me what I can ford! The only thing I know-a is, I gotta twelve-a kids and now there only six!

My good man, statistics prove it costs five dollars a week to provide for a child. Twelve times five is sixty dollars. You only make twenty-five dollars a week! Its economically impossible for you to have twelve children!
We can have a party, just like they do in Hollywood.
That's-a fine! Let there be wine!
And women!
And song!
And women!
And caviar!
And women!
And more women!

Hey, Wacky, I gotta good idea. Why don't-a you and me go play for the party? Eh, look how your dressed? You look-a terrible. It's-a whole bunch-a high class-a people there and you are dressed like a scared scarecrow. Well, it's-a too too bad. They wouldn't let you in dressed that way. Goodbye, Wacky.

[referring to an evening gown]
This is a bright red dress, but technicolor is sooo expensive.
